# fmm — Frontmatter Matters

> Auto-generate code metadata sidecars for LLM navigation

fmm generates .fmm sidecar files alongside your source code. Each sidecar is a small YAML file listing the exports, imports, dependencies, and line count of its companion source file. LLM agents use these sidecars to navigate codebases without reading every source file — reducing token usage by 80-90%.

## Docs

- [Introduction](https://docs.fmm.dev/introduction.html): What fmm is, why sidecars, how it works
- [Installation](https://docs.fmm.dev/getting-started/installation.html): Install from crates.io or source, shell completions
- [Quickstart](https://docs.fmm.dev/getting-started/quickstart.html): First sidecar in 60 seconds — init, search, validate
- [CLI Reference](https://docs.fmm.dev/reference/cli.html): All commands, options, and examples
- [Sidecar Format](https://docs.fmm.dev/reference/sidecar-format.html): .fmm YAML schema, fields, language-specific extensions
- [Configuration](https://docs.fmm.dev/reference/configuration.html): .fmmrc.json options, .fmmignore, MCP server config
- [MCP Tools](https://docs.fmm.dev/reference/mcp-tools.html): MCP server tool schemas for LLM agent integration

## Optional

- [Full documentation](https://docs.fmm.dev/llms-full.txt): Complete documentation in a single file
